result.execSummary:
The defendant Leo Girard Kaseno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Maintain Sex Offender Registry, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leo Girard Kaseno

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant Leo Girard Kaseno in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Leo Girard Kaseno.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates defendant will plea to sole count, 4 months jail, consecutive to 21CF350, court costs, 0 days credit.
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.
State makes statements regarding sentencing. Cites priors. 
Attorney Gramstrup makes statements regarding sentencing. 
Court orders 4 months jail, consecutive to 21CF350, no days credit, costs, 120 days to pay or pay plan.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Leo Girard Kaseno in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad Lalor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Leo Girard Kaseno. 
Att Gramstrup- Client will waive prelim
Court finds probable cause to bind over. Sets arraignment date
Arraignment scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Comply with sex offender registry requirements.

2:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leo Girard Kaseno appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Leo Girard Kaseno. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $2,000 cash. Conditions of comply with sex offender registry. Has been in absconder status from the registry and has a DOC hold. Recites defendants previous criminal history and FTAs. Attorney Reid addresses Defendant's FTAs and asks for $500 cash bond. Indicates defendant can post up to $600.

Court notes concerns over absconder status. Court orders $2000 cash. Comply with sex offender registry requirements.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.
